title: Drawing, "Four Putti Making Music, Study after Lodovico Carracci", 1821–22
medium: Pen and ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk on white wove paper
inscribed: in pen and brown ink at left center: Lodovico Caracci Bologna; at lower left: 21 Lucio Massari Bologna
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Upper drawing of four putti, one with wings, on clouds, one sings from scroll, and one plays horn. Lower drawing of entombment of Christ, with two men carrying corpse, winged putto at lower right, and woman and three figures crowding in from the left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Four Putti Making Music, Study after Lodovico Carracci", 1821–22.
1821–22. Pen and ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3565-2.
